In the RCP8.5 scenario, atmospheric CO 2 shows an accelerated increase until the year 2100, when a radiative forcing of approximately 8.5 Wm âˆ’2 is reached. Thereafter, the CO 2 concentration stabilizes at almost 2000 parts per million (
20 ), yielding the largest warming of all CMIP5 simulations. For each model, we combined the historical simulation, the RCP8.5 simulation, and (if available) the extended RCP8.5 simulation, obtaining one long time series per grid cell and model.
